entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as a person who is pressing Fudge to send envoys to the giants. He is described as having an aura of power around him and his eyes are blazing.

entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is mentioned as a person who is opposing Dumbledore's plan to send envoys to the giants. He is described as being blinded by his love of office and placing too much importance on purity.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as a person who has persuaded the giants to believe that he alone will give them their rights and freedom.

entities.name: giants
entities.description: The giants are mentioned as a group of people who are being targeted by Voldemort. They are described as being hated by the magical community.

relationships.description: Dumbledore is pressing Fudge to send envoys to the giants, as mentioned in the text: 'Extend them the hand of friendship, now, before it is too late...'

Voldemort has persuaded the giants to believe that he alone will give them their rights and freedom, as mentioned in the text: 'as he did before, that he alone among wizards will give them their rights and their freedom!'
